p: Biosurfactants are either secreted extracellularly or attached to cell-bound compounds that decrease surface and interfacial tension and are produced by a large number of prokaryotic and eukaryotic microorganisms ( 1). Biosurfactants are categorized into lipoproteins, lipopolysaccharides, phospholipids, glycerides, and glycolipids according to their chemical groups and microbial origins ( 2, 3).
